title: Remove photo upload UI from the Valentine flow

requirements.summary: Remove all user-facing photo add/upload UI and any related call-to-action text so the UI cannot open an image file chooser.
acceptanceCriteria: No page in the app shows a photo upload control, file picker trigger, or "add/upload photo" call-to-action text.
Users cannot click/tap anywhere in the UI to open a file chooser for images.

file_operations.description: Remove the user-facing photo upload section (including "Add your own picture" / "Upload a photo for our date" text) so there is no clickable area that would open a file chooser.
Remove any remaining photo-slot UI so there is no area in the Valentine flow that implies adding/uploading photos or triggers a file chooser.
Delete the PhotoSlot component to eliminate the underlying file input and click-to-open-file-chooser behavior from the frontend bundle.

requirements.summary: Update PostYesMovieDatePage to remove PhotoSlot and rebalance the layout without any upload area (optionally using a non-editable visual).
acceptanceCriteria: The movie date page renders without empty/unused space where the photo slot previously appeared.
No user-facing text remains that instructs the user to add or upload a picture.

file_operations.description: Remove the PhotoSlot import/render and adjust the grid/layout to stay visually balanced (e.g., movie details span full width and/or include a static non-editable image using frontend/public/assets/generated/hum-aapke-hain-koun-poster.dim_800x1200.png).

requirements.summary: Update ValentineAskPage to remove the readonly PhotoSlot grid from the post-acceptance celebration state.
acceptanceCriteria: The post-acceptance celebration view renders cleanly without the 3-slot photo grid.
All other existing interactions (Yes/No flow, celebration overlay, navigation to the movie date page) continue to work as before.

file_operations.description: Remove the PhotoSlot import and the 3-slot readonly grid from the accepted/celebration state; adjust spacing so the celebration and continue button still look intentional and the movie-date navigation continues to function.

requirements.summary: Retire PhotoSlot so it is not used anywhere in the frontend build.
acceptanceCriteria: There are zero remaining imports/usages of `PhotoSlot` in the frontend codebase.
The frontend builds successfully with no lint/type errors related to removed photo functionality.

file_operations.description: Delete PhotoSlot now that it is no longer used, ensuring no photo functionality remains compiled into the app.
Remove any remaining references/imports of PhotoSlot after deleting the component to keep the build type-safe.
Remove any remaining references/imports of PhotoSlot after deleting the component to keep the build type-safe.
